cs351.core

Interface SoundEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ZombieHouseSoundEngine

    public interface SoundEngine
    The idea behind a SoundEngine is that each frame a number of objects can request that a sound be played relative to a central point (ex: a player location). Sounds that are closer to the specified central point should play at the maximum default volume, while sounds further away from the central point should decrease in volume in some way.
    Author:
    Justin Hall

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void init(Engine engine)
      Initializes the sound engine.
      void queueSoundAtLocation(java.lang.String sound, double x, double y)
      This function should not immediately play the sound at location (LOCATION_X, LOCATION_Y) but should instead add it to a queue.
      void queueSoundAtLocation(java.lang.String sound, double x, double y, double maxVolume, double rate)
      This function will queue a sound at the given location with maximum volume and rate (how fast/slow the sound plays) options.
      void setCentralPoint(double x, double y)
      When this function is called the old central point should be overridden and all future requests to play sounds should use the new point in their volume calculations.
      void shutdown()
      Shuts down the sound engine.
      void update(Engine engine)
      When this function is called, all sounds that were added to the sound queue through the queueSoundAtLocation function should be played appropriately.

    • Method Detail

      • setCentralPoint

        void setCentralPoint(double x,
                     double y)
        When this function is called the old central point should be overridden and all future requests to play sounds should use the new point in their volume calculations.
        Parameters:
        x - center LOCATION_X-coordinate
        y - center LOCATION_Y-coordinate

      • queueSoundAtLocation

        void queueSoundAtLocation(java.lang.String sound,
                          double x,
                          double y)
        This function should not immediately play the sound at location (LOCATION_X, LOCATION_Y) but should instead add it to a queue. When the SoundEngine is told to flush all sounds from its queue, that is the point when all sounds should be played. The reason for this delay is so that the SoundEngine can blend/merge/etc. the sounds it gets so that they sound better to the user.
        Parameters:
        sound - sound to play (should be of the form "sounds/sound.LOCATION_X")
        x - LOCATION_X-coordinate where the sound started
        y - LOCATION_Y-coordinate where the sound started

      • queueSoundAtLocation

        void queueSoundAtLocation(java.lang.String sound,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double maxVolume,
                          double rate)
        This function will queue a sound at the given location with maximum volume and rate (how fast/slow the sound plays) options. This gives more control over how the sound plays back in the game.
        Parameters:
        sound - sound to play (should be of the form "sounds/sound.LOCATION_X")
        x - LOCATION_X-coordinate where the sound started
        y - LOCATION_Y-coordinate where the sound started
        maxVolume - maximum volume of the sound (no lower than 0.0)
        rate - maximum rate of the sound (no lower than 0.0)

      • update

        void update(Engine engine)
        When this function is called, all sounds that were added to the sound queue through the queueSoundAtLocation function should be played appropriately.

      • init

        void init(Engine engine)
        Initializes the sound engine.
        Parameters:
        engine - reference to the main engine

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down the sound engine.
